orig: Maria is staying at a hotel that charges $\$99.95$ per night plus tax for a room. A tax of $8\%$ is applied to the room rate, and an additional onetime untaxed fee of $\$5.00$ is charged by the hotel. Which of the following represents Maria’s total charge, in dollars, for staying $x$ nights?
base: Maria is staying at a hotel that charges $\$${c1}$ per night plus tax for a room. A tax of $${c2}\%$ is applied to the room rate, and an additional onetime untaxed fee of $\$${c3}$ is charged by the hotel. Which of the following represents Maria’s total charge, in dollars, for staying $x$ nights?
solution:
total with tax added is calculated by subtotal $\times ${1+c2*0.01}$
Subtotal is calculated by $${c1} \times$ number of nights
Final solution will be in the form of $(1+\textrm{tax rate}*\frac{1}{100})*(\textrm{price per night}*x \textrm{ nights})+\textrm{untaxed charge}$
